Message.Msg: The biggest challenge remains building out the IT infrastructure that will provide the backbone for enrollmentâ€”the new state health insurance exchanges that will serve as the gateway for individuals to obtain insurance under the Affordable Care Act and find out whether they qualify for Medicaid or insurance subsidies. http://www.cnbc.com/id/100606206

Message.Title: Pumping the Dow
Message.Msg: Dow down 41 at 3:41. Then the manipulators showed up as they do every day. One of the most rigged markets in history.

Topic.Title: Ready or Not: States and Insurers Brace for Obamacare

Message.Msg: Health Insurance companies are currently warning americans that they're insurance premiums are going to rise more during the next year than they have for the past 3 years... ... and mine have risen almost 65% over the past 3 years due to Obamacare. The reason is because Obama seeks to cover all American's equally, whether or not they do anything individually to help with the cost. It's all about "equal outcomes" with socialism... rather than "equal opportunity". S

Topic.Title: Disability: The Defacto "New Welfare System" (NBC news - NPR)

Message.Msg: One of the latest abuses of government spending programs that you may have heard of involves motorized wheel chairs. An article that appeared the other day suggested that 3/4 of all motorized wheelchairs that are paid for by medicare are for people who are NOT qualified to have their cost covered by medicare. The whole reason why America's entitlements and social welfare systems are so massively out of control is because everybody piles on when they can find ways to qualify to get free stuff. Obamacare will fast become the same way... if it's free, everybody will go in to the doctor for every danm hangnail they get... and eventually, rationing will result. Economics 101: Supply/Demand curves. S

Message.Title: The Catalyst
Message.Msg: I happen to be a retired Wall Street executive from Merrill Lynch, and I know a bubble when I see one. This market is running on fumes do to the irresponsible policies of the Fed. A catalyst is all that is needed to burst this ballon. IBM has been a very poor investment since I recommended selling it between 209 - 210 on March 28, 2012 That said, it should hold up better than most stocks during a sharp correction. Right now I prefer cash. With that advice I leave the board. I will you well.
ok thanks. I will you well also.
